@graph.description: Gobi Musallam (cauliflower that has been roasted whole) is a fantastic centerpiece. The whole cauliflower head is lightly blanched then drenched with the luscious Mughlai-inspired makhani sauce and baked. This is a main dish to serve during the holiday season. When roasted, the whole cauliflower looks gorgeous and smells divine. The makhani curry is decadent, creamy, buttery, and fantastic. You can serve the cauliflower as is, or sliced with some sauce on the side, or with naan or other flatbread, salads, rice, or quinoa.

video.description:
Gobi Musallam (cauliflower that has been roasted whole with Butter Masala sauce) is a fantastic centerpiece for any occasion. 
Full Recipe at -- http://www.veganricha.com/2013/06/gobi-musallam-whole-roasted-cauliflower.html

Whole cauliflower head is lightly blanched then drenched with the luscious Mughlai-inspired makhani sauce and baked. The makhani sauce is dairyfree, decadent, creamy, buttery, and fantastic. You can serve the cauliflower as is, or sliced with some sauce on the side, with naan or other flatbread, salads, rice, or quinoa.

recipeIngredient: 1  Cauliflower head  (leaves and tough stem removed and washed)
1  dry red chili or chili flakes to taste
1/4 cup ground cashew  (or 1/3 cup soaked cashews)
1/4 teaspoon raw sugar  (or 1/2 teaspoon maple syrup)

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of water to boil. Use enough water so all of the cauliflower can be immersed in it.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring a large pot of water to boil. Use enough water so all of the cauliflower can be immersed in it.

recipeInstructions.text: Add salt, turmeric and chili and blanch/cook the whole cauliflower.
recipeInstructions.name: Add salt, turmeric and chili and blanch/cook the whole cauliflower.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover and cook for 4 minutes on each side(top and bottom. Flip after 4 minutes)
recipeInstructions.name: Cover and cook for 4 minutes on each side(top and bottom. Flip after 4 minutes)

itemListElement.text: In a pan, add oil and heat over medium heat. Add chopped onion and saute until golden, 6-7 minutes
itemListElement.name: In a pan, add oil and heat over medium heat. Add chopped onion and saute until golden, 6-7 minutes

itemListElement.text: Add ginger, garlic chili and saute for another 2 minutes.Add the spices and mix.
itemListElement.name: Add ginger, garlic chili and saute for another 2 minutes.Add the spices and mix.

itemListElement.text: Add tomatoes, salt, sugar, fenugreek leaves, mix and cook covered until tender. Mash the larger pieces. 8-10 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Add tomatoes, salt, sugar, fenugreek leaves, mix and cook covered until tender. Mash the larger pieces. 8-10 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Cool slightly, then blend with coconut milk and cashews into a smooth thick puree.Taste and adjust salt, spice.
itemListElement.name: Cool slightly, then blend with coconut milk and cashews into a smooth thick puree.Taste and adjust salt, spice.

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F / 200ºc. Oil the baking dish if desired. Place the blanched cauliflower in a baking dish. Slowly drop the puree on top to cover the entire head of the cauliflower. Some sauce will fall on the side.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F / 200ºc. Oil the baking dish if desired. Place the blanched cauliflower in a baking dish. Slowly drop the puree on top to cover the entire head of the cauliflower. Some sauce will fall on the side.

itemListElement.text: Keep about a 1/3 of the sauce to serve on the side later.
itemListElement.name: Keep about a 1/3 of the sauce to serve on the side later.

itemListElement.text: Bake in pre-heated 400 degrees F / 200ºc for 40-45 minutes till the cauliflower is dry to touch and sauce thickens a bit. Turn the dish around after 30 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Bake in pre-heated 400 degrees F / 200ºc for 40-45 minutes till the cauliflower is dry to touch and sauce thickens a bit. Turn the dish around after 30 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Heat the remaining sauce to just about a boil so it thickens and serve on the side.Serve hot with flat breads(Naan/Roti), or salads or quinoa.Chop and fill up wraps or a hoagie roll(to make gobi meatball sub).
